intro: Agalinis ramulifera, commonly known as the slenderstem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink to purple in color. Agalinis ramulifera is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments, often relying on mycorrhizal associations for nutrient uptake.
